newsitem.title: USA: Massachusetts jobless rate hits seven-year low.
newsitem.headline: Massachusetts jobless rate hits seven-year low.

text.p: The Massachusetts Division of Employment and Training reported the unemployment rate in the state dropped to 4 percent in August, its lowest level since June 1989.

The state's service sector continued to show strong job growth in August with 2,400 new jobs. Over the past year, service firms have added 32,800 jobs - or four out of the five new jobs in the state, said Wallace Graham, a spokesman for the agency.
The retail and wholesale trade sectors also posted gains, as did finance, insurance and real estate, the agency said in a statement.

The manufacturing sector ended three-months of modest gains with a loss of 1,100 jobs, pusing the manufacturing jobs base to a new low 443,100, the agency said. That figure is expected to continue its decline.
